intro: Schradera nervulosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined schradera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Schradera nervulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
